intro: Polyosma nhatrangensis, commonly known as Nhatrang bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia, particularly Vietnam. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
